text: so it really worked very well it in the
forest it's a very modern and cool
building hidden in these woods is a 15
foot high
13-foot wide structure in it you can
literally hide in plain sight
or if you prefer really take time out to
reflect on the meaning of it all because
this is a hotel made entirely of mirrors
it's a boyhood dream of owner Kent
Linville when I was young I built my own
tree house I saw and I can have a
feeling of freedom to sit up in the tree
and look down to the other people so
Kent got thinking maybe everyone else
would like to be a kid up a tree again
he called a team of brilliant architects
and gave them a nice grown-up challenge
sustainable luxury at one with nature
so for $600 a night at the tree hotel
you get a double bedroom an eating area
and a bathroom what's amazing is that
this whole six ton structure is
supported by a single living pine tree
just ten inches wide that's all down to
some clever engineering
the hotel was built in two halves then
lifted into position with cranes on
either side of the tree it's held in
place by some stabilizing almost
invisible wires and a series of tree
friendly metal rings giving the
impression that it's just floating in
the forest Scotch pines are very sturdy
trees but no one had ever attempted to
build anything like this before
nobody really know two hundred percent
that it will be work like this so kids
sought the advice of some experts at the
local university who suggested a way he
might strengthen his supporting tree but
first he had to get it to talk to the
other trees sounds crazy until a few
decades ago I think people would have
said you're crazy but there's increasing
research showing now that there is quite
an advanced levels of signaling perhaps
even communication between plants if one
tree get damaged the other tree can in
some way feel it or get the connection
with it many plants when they experience
attack by insects or other kinds of
herbivores they raise the levels of
defensive chemicals inside their leaves
in their stems and it's very common that
they release chemicals into the air or
down through the roots into the soil and
this induces these same changes in the
neighboring plants as well
when pine trees are chopped down their
stumps are believed to send out a
chemical aroma as a signal to other
nearby trees to strengthen themselves
against a tag so Kent experimented with
a couple of trees near the hotel he was
planning and lo and behold his pine tree
produced extra sap to strengthen itself
to
if you want to make a tree house a tree
hotel you must be sure that it worked
because you take in guests and we have
seen now after two year it had been
storm rain snow and it still work
really good
